info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:52AM PDT until August 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Lincoln County in south central Nevada... Southern Nye County in south central Nevada... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 900 AM PDT. * At 652 AM PDT, Moderate to locally heavy rainfall persists across the Amargosa Desert and Pahrump Valley...with one hour rain rates of up to a quarter inch per hour. The Flood Warning will be extended a couple more hours to account for the continued flood risk, HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump, Mercury, Beatty, Spring Mountains, Lathrop Wells, Amargosa Valley, Indian Springs, Willow Creek Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground, Mountain Springs and Mt. Potosi. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
